003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.util.bits;
010
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
012
013/**
014 * This class implements a true 2D bitmap container, i.e., each 0/1 element
015 * occupies only a single bit (unlike {@code boolean} arrays, which require at 
016 * least 8 bits per element).
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2022/09/13
020 * @see BitVector
021 */
022public class BitMap {
023        
024        private final int width;
025        private final int height;
026        private final BitVector bitvec;
027        
028        /**
029         * Constructor, creates an empty bitmap (with all elements set to 0).
030         * Both dimensions must be at least 1.
031         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
032         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
033         */
034        public BitMap(int width, int height) {
035                this(width, height, null);
036        }
037        
038        /**
039         * Constructor, creates a bitmap from a one-dimensional byte array.
040         * Elements of the specified byte array are assumed in row-major order,
041         * zero values map to 0, anything else to 1.
042         * Passing {@code null} for the byte array creates an empty
043         * bitmap (with all elements set to 0).
044         * Both dimensions must be at least 1.
045         * 
046         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
047         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
048         * @param bytes a byte array ({@code null} is allowed) 
049         */
050        public BitMap(int width, int height, byte[] bytes) {
051                if (width <= 0) {
052                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("width of bitmap must be at least 1: " + width);
053                }
054                if (height <= 0) {
055                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("height of bitmap must be at least 1: " + height);
056                }
057                if (bytes != null && width * height != bytes.length) {
058                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("width/height do not match byte[] length: " + bytes.length);
059                }
060                this.width = width;
061                this.height = height;
062                this.bitvec = (bytes != null) ? 
063                                BitVector.from(bytes) : 
064                                BitVector.create(width * height);
065        }
066        
067        // ---------------------------------------------------------
068        
069        /**
070         * Returns the width of this {@link BitMap}.
071         * @return the width
072         */
073        public int getWidth() {
074                return this.width;
075        }
076        
077        /**
078         * Returns the height of this {@link BitMap}.
079         * @return the height
080         */
081        public int getHeight() {
082                return this.height;
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
087         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
088         * @param x the x-coordinate
089         * @param y the y-coordinate
090         * @return as described
091         */
092        public boolean get(int x, int y) {
093                return bitvec.get(y * width + x);
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
098         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
099         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
100         * @return as described
101         */
102        public boolean get(PntInt p) {
103                return bitvec.get(p.y * width + p.x);
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
108         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
109         * @param x the x-coordinate
110         * @param y the y-coordinate
111         * @param val a boolean value
112         */
113        public void set(int x, int y, boolean val) {
114                if (val) {
115                        this.set(x, y);
116                }
117                else {
118                        this.unset(x, y);
119                }
120        }
121        
122        /**
123         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
124         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
125         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
126         * @param val a boolean value
127         */
128        public void set(PntInt p, boolean val) {
129                set(p.x, p.y, val);
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
134         * @param x the x-coordinate
135         * @param y the y-coordinate
136         */
137        public void set(int x, int y) {
138                bitvec.set(y * width + x);
139        }
140        
141        /**
142         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
143         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
144         */
145        public void set(PntInt p) {
146                bitvec.set(p.y * width + p.x);
147        }
148        
149        /**
150         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
151         * @param x the x-coordinate
152         * @param y the y-coordinate
153         */
154        public void unset(int x, int y) {
155                bitvec.unset(y * width + x);
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
160         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
161         */
162        public void unset(PntInt p) {
163                bitvec.unset(p.y * width + p.x);
164        }
165        
166        /**
167         * Sets all elements to 1.
168         */
169        public void setAll() {
170                bitvec.setAll();
171        }
172        
173        /**
174         * Sets all elements to 0.
175         */
176        public void unsetAll() {
177                bitvec.unsetAll();
178        }
179        
180        /**
181         * Returns the underlying 1D {@link BitVector}.
182         * @return the bit vector
183         */
184        public BitVector getBitVector() {
185                return this.bitvec;
186        }
187        
188        /**
189         * Returns the contents of this bitmap as a one-dimensional
190         * {@code byte} array, with elements in row-major order.
191         * Bit-value 0 maps to byte value 0, value 1 maps to 1.
192         * @return a one-dimensional {@code byte} array
193         */
194        public byte[] toByteArray() {
195                return this.bitvec.toByteArray();
196        }
197        
198        // static methods --------------------------------------------------
199        
200        /**
201         * Creates a new 2D bitmap of the specified size.
202         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
203         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
204         * @return the new bitmap
205         */
206        public static BitMap create(int width, int height) {
207                return new BitMap(width, height);
208        }
209        
210}
